awd_titl_txt: SIAM Interdisciplinary Conferences in the Mathematical and Computational Sciences
awd_abstract_narration:
Under this grant, the Society for Industrial and Applied Mathematics (SIAM) will organize and run a series of conferences and workshops in the mathematical and computational sciences during the three-year period between September 2018 and September 2021. These SIAM conferences form an important part of the research, education and technology transfer infrastructure for applied and computational mathematics. The funding of this grant will support travel of students and early career professionals, facilitating the integration of education with research. The funding will also support the travel of invited speakers to the conferences and the dissemination of invited conference presentations to the wider community through selective recording of talks and/or live streaming. 

SIAM conferences and workshops are highly interdisciplinary and foster the communication of the latest fundamental and applied research and applications to mathematical and computational scientists, physical and social scientists, and engineers from academia, industry and government. SIAM conferences are designed to identify and disseminate knowledge of emerging areas of research. A sampling of conferences to be held during the award period include those on the following topics: Mathematics of Planet Earth (September, 2018), International Conference on Data Mining (April, 2019), Uncertainty Quantification (May, 2020), and Applied Algebraic Geometry (July, 2021).

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.

por.por_cntn:
This grant, SIAM Interdisciplinary Conferences in Applied and Computational Mathematics, supported conferences in the mathematical and computational sciences. The primary objective of the conference series is to provide a forum for communication among researchers in mathematical and computational sciences and their applications. The series offered a unique opportunity for researchers and practitioners to communicate the state of the art in applied and computational mathematics and to identify and address the latest challenges and opportunities.

 

SIAM conferences play a key role in promoting research in key areas of mathematical modeling, numerical methods, computational science and their application. These conferences are an important venue in which to announce new results, build collaborations, and exchange ideas.

The 36 conferences and 10 workshops covered under this grant focused on the following topics: Mathematics of Planet Earth, Computational Science and Engineering, Geosciences, Data Mining, Network Science, Financial Mathematics and Engineering, Control and Systems Theory, Geometric Design, Applied Algebraic Geometry, Analysis of Partial Differential Equations, Parallel Processing, Combinatorial Scientific Computing, Imaging Science, Applied Linear Algebra, Applied and Computational Discrete Algorithms, Optimization, Discrete Mathematics, Uncertainty Quantification, Life Sciences, Applied Mathematics Education, Nonlinear Waves and Coherent Structures, Materials Research, and Mathematics of Data Science.

Scientists from academia, national laboratories, and industry gave presentations on innovative mathematical and computational methods and their applications at these conferences. In addition, all of the conferences provided an environment for networking and developing collaborations.

The intellectual merit of the conferences funded under this grant has been very high. Online evaluations of conferences reveal that 73-94%  of the respondents agreed with the statement that the technical program was excellent and 70-89% of attendees said that they learned something useful for their research programs at these conferences. An analysis of attendance at these conferences demonstrates the success of SIAM's efforts to reach out to the broader communities of mathematical scientists, applications scientists, and engineers in industry and government. Industry and government attendees accounted for, on average, 15-19% of all attendees.

Student attendance at SIAM conferences held during the grant period ranged from 20-53% attendees with a median of 30%. The combination of choice of subject, low fees, and opportunities afforded by conference design, particularly the chance to interact in an interdisciplinary environment, continues to attract substantial student participation.  There has been an increase in the number of students applying for travel support to conferences. To meet this growing demand, SIAM complements grant funds by soliciting industrial sponsorship and devoting a portion of its operating funds to travel support.

 

The key presentations are made available to public on the web at SIAM Presents. Another means of disseminating the results presented at the conferences is that key speakers are invited to write general description of aspects of their talk to be printed in SIAM News; SIAM News is also posted and available online to the general public.

 

Funds from this grant also supported events dedicated to broadening participation in the mathematical sciences to include underrepresented groups, including support for the annual Workshop Celebrating Diversity, and also for the 2019 Collaborative Workshop for Women in Mathematical Biology, and to providing professional development for graduate students and early career researchers through an online event at the 2020 Annual Meeting. The conference programs are currently available on SIAM's website: https://www.siam.org/conferences/archives. Within the specific conference archives, proceedings and workshop notes (if produced) and abstracts are available for most conferences.

For selected conferences, recordings of invited talks and selected minisymposia are or will be available online on SIAM Presents (https://www.siam.org/Conferences/About-SIAM-Conferences/Featured-Lectures-Videos).

In addition, SIAM News publishes special issues on conference presentations. All are available on SIAM News online (https://sinews.siam.org)
